docs.lead_paragraph: New Texas abortion restrictions that would leave nearly 1 million women without any close options to end a pregnancy left a federal judge Wednesday signaling unease with the long drives the law would cause some abortion-seekers.

headline.main: Judge Questions Burdens for Texas Abortion Access
headline.print_headline: Judge Questions Burdens for Texas Abortion Access

docs.snippet: New Texas abortion restrictions that would leave nearly 1 million women without any close options to end a pregnancy left a federal judge Wednesday signaling unease with the long drives the law would cause some abortion-seekers.

docs.lead_paragraph: Crossing borders is a part of life in El Paso in far West Texas, where people may walk into Mexico to visit family or commute to New Mexico for work. But getting an abortion doesn't require leaving town.

headline.main: Texas Abortion Law Could Send Women Across Borders
headline.print_headline: Texas Abortion Law Could Send Women Across Borders

docs.snippet: Crossing borders is a part of life in El Paso in far West Texas, where people may walk into Mexico to visit family or commute to New Mexico for work. But getting an abortion doesn't require leaving town.

docs.lead_paragraph: China announced Tuesday the birth of extremely rare panda triplets in a further success for the country's artificial breeding program.

headline.main: China Announces Birth of Rare Panda Triplets
headline.print_headline: China Announces Birth of Rare Panda Triplets

docs.snippet: China announced Tuesday the birth of extremely rare panda triplets in a further success for the country's artificial breeding program.

docs.lead_paragraph: Moving to allay the concerns of Iran’s supreme leader about the country’s declining fertility rate, Iranian lawmakers passed legislation that prohibits all surgical operations to permanently prevent pregnancy.

headline.main: Iran: Permanent Contraception Through Surgery Is Outlawed
headline.print_headline: Iran: Permanent Contraception Through Surgery Is Outlawed

docs.abstract: Iranian lawmakers pass legislation that prohibits all surgical operations to permanently prevent pregnancy; move is meant to allay concerns of supreme leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei about country's declining fertility rate.
docs.snippet: Moving to allay the concerns of Iran’s supreme leader about the country’s declining fertility rate, Iranian lawmakers passed legislation that prohibits all surgical operations to permanently prevent pregnancy.

docs.lead_paragraph: Republicans want to attract black voters, but are still invested in the reactionary politics of race.

headline.main: Can the G.O.P. Ever Attract Black Voters?
headline.print_headline: Can the G.O.P. Ever Attract Black Voters?

docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Prof Jelani Cobb assesses why Republican Party has trouble attracting black voters; cites Republican National Committee's national effort on college campuses to draw young black voters; contends honest appeal to African-Americans would start with admission that Republicans did not lose black vote but forfeited it.
docs.snippet: Republicans want to attract black voters, but are still invested in the reactionary politics of race.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Australian biological parents of twins caught up in a surrogacy scandal in Thailand wanted both babies but the surrogate mother threatened to involve the police and they feared she would keep both children, they said on Sunday.

headline.main: Australian Parents of Thai Surrogate Twin Say They Feared Losing Both Babies
headline.print_headline: Australian Parents of Thai Surrogate Twin Say They Feared Losing Both Babies

docs.snippet: The Australian biological parents of twins caught up in a surrogacy scandal in Thailand wanted both babies but the surrogate mother threatened to involve the police and they feared she would keep both children, they said on Sunday.

docs.lead_paragraph: An Australian couple denied they had abandoned their son with his Thai surrogate after learning he had Down syndrome, saying in an interview broadcast on Sunday that the woman demanded she be allowed to keep the boy.
docs.snippet: An Australian couple denied they had abandoned their son with his Thai surrogate after learning he had Down syndrome, saying in an interview broadcast on Sunday that the woman demanded she be allowed to keep the boy.

docs.lead_paragraph: Seriously, people. It’s only a bad year if you’re Santa Claus.
docs.abstract: Gail Collins Op-Ed column contends victory in Tennessee Republican primary by incumbent Rep Scott DesJarlais underscores how incumbents have been doing well in the primary season; notes only three members of Congress have lost their seats.
docs.snippet: Seriously, people. It’s only a bad year if you’re Santa Claus.
